endemo2.sectors.industry_sector.Industry¶

class Industry(country_name, population, country_gdp, input_manager)[source]¶

Bases: Sector

The Industry class represents the industry sector of one country. It holds all products produced by this industry.

Parameters:

  • population (Population) – The population object of the country.

  • country_gdp (TimeStepSequence) – The countries’ GDP Timeseries

  • input_manager (Input) – The models input data from the Excel files.

Variables:

  • country_name (str) – Name of the country this industry is located in.

  • _products (dict[str, Product]) – All products in this industry.

  • rest_calc_basis_year (int) – Year that is used as the starting point for the rest sector percentage prediction.

  • rest_calc_data (dict[DemandType, (float, float)]) – rest sector start-percentage and rest sector start-demand, used to forecast the rest sector demand for a certain year.

  • rest_growth_rate (float) – Growth rate percentage of the rest sector as specified in Set_and_Control_Parameters.xlsx in interval [0,1].

  • country_population (Population) – The population of the country, this industry belongs to.

  • nuts2_distribution_by_installed_capacities (bool) – If true, distribution of (forecasted) demand over nuts2 regions is calculated by percentages given in the installed_capacities file, otherwise distribution is calculated according to population density.

Methods

__init__

calculate_demand_split_by_nuts2

Calls the calculate_product_demand function and splits the result according to capacity for each NUTS2 region.

calculate_demand_split_by_nuts2(product_name, year)[source]¶

Calls the calculate_product_demand function and splits the result according to capacity for each NUTS2 region.

Parameters:

  • product_name (str) – Name of product to calculate demand for.

  • year (int) – The target year, the demand should be calculated for.

Return type:

dict[str, Demand]

Returns:

The dictionary of {nuts2_region -> demand}.

calculate_forecasted_demand(year)[source]¶

Sums over the demand of each product.

Parameters:

year (int) – Target year the demand should be calculated for.

Return type:

Demand

Returns:

The demand summed over all products in this industry.

calculate_forecasted_demand_split_by_nuts2(year)[source]¶

Calls the calculate_demand_split_by_nuts2 function and sums over all products.

Parameters:

year (int) – The target year, the demand should be calculated for.

Return type:

dict[str, Demand]

Returns:

The dictionary of {nuts2_region -> demand}.

calculate_product_demand(product_name, year)[source]¶

Getter for a products demand by product name and for the year. If the product is not in the industry, a Demand object indicating zero demand is returned.

Parameters:

  • product_name (str) – The name of the product, whose demand should be returned.

  • year (int) – Target year the demand should be calculated for.

Return type:

Demand

Returns:

The demand of the product in this industry.

calculate_rest_demand_split_by_nuts2(year)[source]¶

Calls the calculate_rest_sector_demand function and splits the result according to capacity for each NUTS2 region.

Parameters:

year (int) – The target year, the demand should be calculated for.

Return type:

dict[str, Demand]

Returns:

The dictionary of {nuts2_region -> demand}.

calculate_rest_sector_demand(target_year)[source]¶

Calculate the rest sector demand for a certain year.

\[\begin{split}rest_{\text{start_year}}[TWh]=perc_{\text{start_year}}*demand_{\text{start_year}}[TWh]\\ rest(y)[TWh] = rest_{\text{start_year}}[TWh]*(1+r)^{y-\text{start_year}}\end{split}\]
Parameters:

target_year (int) – The year, the rest sector demand should be calculated for.

Return type:

Demand

Returns:

The demand of the rest sector in given year rest(y).

calculate_total_demand(year)[source]¶

Calculate total demand, including the forecasted demand and rest sector.

Parameters:

year (int) – Target year the demand should be calculated for.

Return type:

Demand

Returns:

The total demand summed over all products in this industry and rest sector.

calculate_total_demand_split_by_nuts2(year)[source]¶

Calculate total demand, including the forecasted demand and rest sector.

Parameters:

year (int) – Target year the demand should be calculated for.

Return type:

dict[str, Demand]

Returns:

The total demand summed over all products in this industry and rest sector, split by nuts2 regions.

get_product(name)[source]¶

Getter for a product from the industry.

Parameters:

name (str) – Name of the product. Example: “steel_prim”.

Return type:

Product

Returns:

Product object with the matching name.

prog_product_amount(product_name, year)[source]¶

Getter for the predicted amount of a product within this industry.

Parameters:

  • product_name (str) – Name of the product. Example: “steel_prim”.

  • year (int) – Target year, which the amount should be calculated for.

Return type:

float

Returns:

The products predicted amount in target year.
